snippet.textDisplay: It's good but Shadow Hearts is supposed to have that creepy,mysterious battle theme that repeatedly sends chills down your spine. It's supposed to be a dark game. Now I'm not emo or whatever,but I do love the storyline of Shadow Hearts one and two. The bgm made you actually feel like you're in a horror movie/crime scene drama. Then it came together all marvelously linking both the first and second game. The good ending of part 2 explains how Alice is alive at the end of the first one good ending. Yuri manages to kill Atman and beat the living or dead shit out of those masks. Now given Yuri's personality,he is more arrogant and laid back in the first game. Even more that pacing to the good ending was loose and left loopholes. Seeing how Yuri's personality flipped when discovering that Alice was about to be killed. He beat down the masks and broke through that door. So in short,part 1 and part 2 was great,it ended in a tragedy in both games really,but towards the end of part 2,Yuri was given another chance to make things right. He was sent back to the beginning of Shadow Hearts one where he knew what he had to do it appeared.
snippet.textOriginal: It's good but Shadow Hearts is supposed to have that creepy,mysterious battle theme that repeatedly sends chills down your spine. It's supposed to be a dark game. Now I'm not emo or whatever,but I do love the storyline of Shadow Hearts one and two. The bgm made you actually feel like you're in a horror movie/crime scene drama. Then it came together all marvelously linking both the first and second game. The good ending of part 2 explains how Alice is alive at the end of the first one good ending. Yuri manages to kill Atman and beat the living or dead shit out of those masks. Now given Yuri's personality,he is more arrogant and laid back in the first game. Even more that pacing to the good ending was loose and left loopholes. Seeing how Yuri's personality flipped when discovering that Alice was about to be killed. He beat down the masks and broke through that door. So in short,part 1 and part 2 was great,it ended in a tragedy in both games really,but towards the end of part 2,Yuri was given another chance to make things right. He was sent back to the beginning of Shadow Hearts one where he knew what he had to do it appeared.

snippet.textDisplay: @Zadox reo So true, I recommend using a guide. It makes it a lot easier to follow through. If I remember right, if you pass a certain point without collecting a certain item for the final stage of a fusion, then you cannot initiate the final fusion. You need all fusions in order to fight Seraphic Radiance, which makes sense, you can't go fighting a god when you haven't even conquered the prerequisites. Shadow Hearts will always be on of my favorite games
snippet.textOriginal: @Zadox reo So true, I recommend using a guide. It makes it a lot easier to follow through. If I remember right, if you pass a certain point without collecting a certain item for the final stage of a fusion, then you cannot initiate the final fusion. You need all fusions in order to fight Seraphic Radiance, which makes sense, you can't go fighting a god when you haven't even conquered the prerequisites. Shadow Hearts will always be on of my favorite games

snippet.textDisplay: +Edge Valmond luckly I have beaten Shadow Hearts 1, but I have not complete the game in 100%, have not collected or cleared everything, I think I cleared the game at 78 or 81% something like that, Shadow Hearts will go down in history as the best dark jrpg games ever.
snippet.textOriginal: +Edge Valmond luckly I have beaten Shadow Hearts 1, but I have not complete the game in 100%, have not collected or cleared everything, I think I cleared the game at 78 or 81% something like that, Shadow Hearts will go down in history as the best dark jrpg games ever.

snippet.textDisplay: @Zadox reo lol I always make sure I had my team strong since I had no sense in direction, so my next best bet was grinding. I remember for one mask in a replay of the story, I forgot some things, and the Judgment ring I think it was called was invisible. Lucky thing I memorized the Judgment ring and all characters attack point. I even hit perfect a few times. Though I have to say one of the most thrilling battles was the Seraphic Radiance battle. You're only allowed to use Yuri in a two part battle. First against his father and then his fathers fusion form of the Seraphic Radiance. That whole battle I was on the edge, I did not want to start over lol.
snippet.textOriginal: @Zadox reo lol I always make sure I had my team strong since I had no sense in direction, so my next best bet was grinding. I remember for one mask in a replay of the story, I forgot some things, and the Judgment ring I think it was called was invisible. Lucky thing I memorized the Judgment ring and all characters attack point. I even hit perfect a few times. Though I have to say one of the most thrilling battles was the Seraphic Radiance battle. You're only allowed to use Yuri in a two part battle. First against his father and then his fathers fusion form of the Seraphic Radiance. That whole battle I was on the edge, I did not want to start over lol.

snippet.textDisplay:
You know whats weird.
When I was in the 5th grade I actually drew a person with tannish skin color with his arms crossed facing sideways. He had a headband but it was red, the pants were the same color though.

I just think it's weird how I drew sumthing nearly identical and I didn't know about the game till 7 years later.

snippet.textDisplay: @zeonmystic That bothered me too about Covenant, but the thing that was an absolute killer for me was a little, mostly irrelevant aspect of the story, that being *SPOILER* the fact that it follows the bad ending of Shadow Hearts, the one where Alice dies. snippet.textOriginal: @zeonmystic That bothered me too about Covenant, but the thing that was an absolute killer for me was a little, mostly irrelevant aspect of the story, that being *SPOILER* the fact that it follows the bad ending of Shadow Hearts, the one where Alice dies. Alice was easily my favorite character in Shadow Hearts, and after learning that her dying was canon, I just couldn't bring myself to continue playing.

snippet.textDisplay: @YinYang19 -cont- it stands to reason that other cultures, particularly those who practiced those forms of spiritual medium rituals, would have access to similar abilities. With Yuri and Kurando, it was more a sort of Shinto/Taoist-esque practice. Sorry again, just thought that might explain it in case you still wondered or if anyone else had a similar question and happened by here.
snippet.textOriginal: @YinYang19 -cont- it stands to reason that other cultures, particularly those who practiced those forms of spiritual medium rituals, would have access to similar abilities. With Yuri and Kurando, it was more a sort of Shinto/Taoist-esque practice. Sorry again, just thought that might explain it in case you still wondered or if anyone else had a similar question and happened by here.

snippet.textDisplay: @YinYang19 I know this is hell of late, and I'm very sorry. But, during Covenant, Rasputin and Nicolai both state that Soul Fusion isn't only practiced by the Harmonixers, as they both made soul pacts with demons that allowed them to fuse. It was somewhat different, but if you consider that Shania comes from the Native American society- which practiced various forms of shamanic 'spirit animal' rituals where people would become on with their totem in a trance-like state- cont.
snippet.textOriginal: @YinYang19 I know this is hell of late, and I'm very sorry. But, during Covenant, Rasputin and Nicolai both state that Soul Fusion isn't only practiced by the Harmonixers, as they both made soul pacts with demons that allowed them to fuse. It was somewhat different, but if you consider that Shania comes from the Native American society- which practiced various forms of shamanic 'spirit animal' rituals where people would become on with their totem in a trance-like state- cont.

snippet.textDisplay: Hiro: No, that started with the original. There's always been a slightly silly humour to the series. FTNW took it way too far and removed almost all the serious elements that made the original two great.
